Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2009 03:51AM Rainenz wrote: Hi Kerry I had FEC followed by Taxol last time as I had already had AC.  I found that I tolerated FEC much better than AC.  The first dose is the worst as you are going into the unknown.  For me I found that as long as I took all the anti nausea drugs on time, ate a little and often and drank heaps I had no problems.  If what they give you is not working tell them straight away and get something stronger. Good luck with you tx. Hugs Raine
Posts.Title: Starting FEC-T tomorrow.... KerryMac pip57

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2011 09:44PM Rainenz wrote: Hi All Hope you have all had a great Christmas.  I celebrated 15 years since my 1st dx with 6 pos nodes this last Christmas Eve and 5 1/2 years since my 2nd dx with 29 pos nodes. In this time I have seen my two boys complete school, find lovely partners and produce 3 beautiful grandchildren, so feel realluy blessed to still be here enjoying life and my growing family.
Posts.Title: Positive nodes with long term survival many Lily55

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2012 10:39PM Rainenz wrote: Hi Teeballmum I too went into surgery thinking my staging would be mimimal as it was found on my annual mammagram and nothing had shown up on my previous one only 8 months earlier.  I had gone for minimal surgery lumpectomy and SNB. Came out of theatre to find I had had a full auxillary clearance and when my path results came in I didn't have clear margins even though my surgeon had taken extra at the time of surgery and I had 29+ nodes making me a stage 3C. Had to go back for a full Mastectomy followed by chemo and rads. In saying this you will be happy to know that I am now 6 years out from that and doing well. All the best  Raine

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2009 08:58PM - edited Jan 11, 2009 09:04PM by Rainenz Hi Kerry I was born on the Kapiti Coast and now live in Palmerston North. During my tx i kept up my walking and made sure I drank plenty. As for diet I just ate what I fancied, had small snacks often rather than big meals. I forgot to say in my last post that although I am 2 yrs out from finishing tx for my stage III bc. I have just got to 12 yrs since I was 1st dx with a stage II bc on the other side.  I have seen my sons growup and produce my 2 beautiful grandchildren.  As for stats they are only numbers and we are all different and definately not a number.
